data.enText: a disadvantage or problem that makes sth a less attractive idea

data.chText: 它的主要缺点是成本高。
data.enText: The main drawback to it is the cost.

data.chText: 这是新系统的一大弊端。
data.enText: This is the one major drawback of the new system.

simple_means.memory_skill: draw 拉 + back 后面 →〔把人〕向后拉 → 缺点

ex.chText: 他的无知使他处于不利地位。
ex.enText: His ignorance placed him at a disadvantage.
The two plans have their advantages and disadvantages.

synonyms.bx: 指引起问题、妨碍某人或某事成功或发挥作用的因素。

ex.chText: 这座城市唯一的不足就是交通。
ex.enText: The only drawback of this city is its traffic.

ex.chText: 这个手机的主要毛病在于它的电池不耐用。
ex.enText: The main drawback of this cellphone is that its battery easily loses its charge.

synonyms.bx: 指计划、产品等的不足之处。

ex.chText: 没受过教育的确是一个障碍。
ex.enText: Lack of education is a real handicap.

ex.chText: 如果他打算入伍，那么视力不好可以算是一个大大的不利条件。
ex.enText: Poor eyesight can be a serious handicap if he wants to join the army.

synonyms.bx: 指妨碍某人达成目标的因素。

tr: the quality of being a hindrance
example: he pointed out all the drawbacks to my plan

value.def: A drawback is an aspect of something or someone that makes them less acceptable than they would otherwise be.

example.ex: He felt the apartment's only drawback was that it was too small.
example.tran: 他觉得这个公寓唯一的缺点就是太小了。

partsOfSpeech.dec: drag 拉 + g + y …的 → 拖拉的
draw 拉 + back 后面 →〔把人〕向后拉 → 缺点
draw 拉 + l → 拉长语调说话
over 过度 + draft 拉 → 从银行拿出了过多的钱 → 透支
with 相反 + draw 拉 → 向后拉 → 撤回
